title: They made China’s economic dream a reality. Now, they struggle to survive
description: China’s first generation of migrant workers helped build the country into an economic powerhouse. But now, as they age out of the workforce, they face a bleak future with meagre benefits – or none at all.

title: Coming UN human rights council vote another test of US-China rivalry
description: Beijing’s critics are pushing for voting countries in Asia to leave their ballots blank, but Washington’s track record on human rights hurts its standing.

title: Kenya to seek US$1b from China for stalled railway, ‘more time’ to repay debts, deputy president says
description: President William Ruto is expected to meet China’s Xi Jinping during a trip to Beijing for the third Belt and Road Forum this month.

title: American and Nepalese climbers killed or missing after avalanches strike Tibetan peak
description: Chinese authorities confirm that American mountaineer Anna Gutu and her guide Mingmar Sherpa were killed on Shishapangma.

title: Why China’s focus on African farm produce will not blur outlook for infrastructure push
description: New initiatives to boost Africa’s agricultural and industrial modernisation do not mean a shift away from infrastructure building but rather the launch of a parallel track, observers say.

title: China calls for ‘calm and restraint’ as Israel declares war after deadly Hamas raid
description: China is ‘deeply concerned about the current escalation of tension and violence in Palestine and Israel’, foreign ministry says in ceasefire call.

title: US senators defy backlash at home to test China’s engagement first-hand
description: After a 4-year pause, Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer is leading lawmakers for ‘direct, candid and respectful’ conversations with Chinese leadership.

title: China’s third-quarter IPOs decline amid efforts by regulator to tighten the pace of fundraising
description: There were 91 IPOs worth US$15.8 billion in the three months to September, down from 105 share listings worth US$20 billion in the second quarter.

title: As Chinese families cut costs, studying abroad goes on the chopping block
description: The middle-class households that drove China’s historic wave of international students are now re-evaluating, as businesses have closed and domestic alternatives have become more appealing.
